Class BinaryClockSolver2

java.lang.Object
BinaryClockSolver2
public class BinaryClockSolver2
extends java.lang.Object
Gets a clock input separated by ":" and turns it into binary output

The binary output is outputted to look like a clock.

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BinaryClockSolver2()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.lang.String[] binaryClock​(java.lang.String[] bs)
    Changes the binary value to an output that can be read on screen.
    static java.lang.String[] changeToBinary​(java.lang.String[] ss)
    Gets the string array input and changes each index to binary.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    This is the main method of the program.
    static void printUsage()
    Informs the user of the correct way to run the program when they have made an entry error.

  • Constructor Details

    • BinaryClockSolver2

      public BinaryClockSolver2()

  • Method Details

    • split

      public static java.lang.String[] split​(java.lang.String input)
      Gets the string input and outputs an array of strings
      Parameters:
      input - A string that is formatted with colons
      Returns:
      String array with the values of the hour minute and second at each index.

    • changeToBinary

      public static java.lang.String[] changeToBinary​(java.lang.String[] ss)
      Gets the string array input and changes each index to binary.
      Parameters:
      ss - A string array that has hour, minute, and second times at each input
      Returns:
      String array with the binary values of the hour minute and second at each index.

    • binaryClock

      public static java.lang.String[] binaryClock​(java.lang.String[] bs)
      Changes the binary value to an output that can be read on screen. has a lowercase o for 0 and a star for 1.
      Parameters:
      bs - A string array that contains the binary values for the hour, minute and second of the clock
      Returns:
      String array with the values of the hour minute and second at each index that the user sees.

    • printUsage

      public static void printUsage()
      Informs the user of the correct way to run the program when they have made an entry error. It also exits the program, assuming that the user error will cause an un-runnable condition.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method of the program. It first verifies the arguments from the command line, and splits the string using the split method. After that, it calls the changeToBinary method and the binaryClock then displays the results using a for loop.
      Parameters:
      args - 1 is used: [0] = the time, using : to separate hours, minutes, and seconds.
